p: In line with the first hypothesis, we found that animals' climatic niche breadth was positively associated with the effective number of plant partners in the regional pollination and seed-dispersal networks ( Fig. 1a,b). In contrast, climatic niche breadth of plants was not related to the effective number of animal partners ( Fig. 1a,b). For both plants and animals, we found no relationship between climatic niche breadth and complementary specialization dâ€² (a measure of the uniqueness of interaction partners relative to other species; Supplementary Table 1). These trends were qualitatively similar across the individual networks ( Supplementary Table 2).
